{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, radiotherapy can cause radiation induced osteosarcoma. Osteosarcoma is a type of bone cancer that can develop as a result of exposure to radiation. Radiotherapy involves the use of high-energy radiation to kill cancer cells, but it can also damage healthy cells in the process. This damage can sometimes lead to the development of secondary cancers, including osteosarcoma. Therefore, the answer is A. yes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
